title: Challenge Accepted: I Created 5 Elegant Winter Outfits From Madewell and J.Crew for Under $452
text: I'm not sure if many people know this, but one of my favorite pastimes is curating my ideal outfits from various brands and retailers. It's a thrilling yet dangerously tempting hobby; I often purchase far more than I intend to. If you're on a budget or participating in a no-spend challenge this January, you might want to steer clear of this activity.Recently, as I was piecing together looks from both J.Crew and Madewell, I decided to take on a fun challenge: creating five stylish winter outfits that wouldn't break the bank.What follows are carefully selected outfits that cater to various occasions this winter. Whether you're seeking a chic ensemble for a cozy weekend getaway, a romantic date night with someone special, or perhaps a fresh take on your workwear, I've got you covered. With an array of cozy sweaters, sophisticated wool coats, and timeless boots, each outfit exudes elevated style for the chilly season. The cherry on top? None of the curated looks exceeds $452.Outfit #1(Image credit: J.Crew, Madewell)When I saw this sweater with the attached scarf, I knew I had to create an outfit around it. Initially, I considered pairing it with blue straight-leg jeans. However, I found the perfect pair of wide-leg trousers in a complementary shade. I added J.Crew's best-selling brown suede bucket bagand supple chocolate-brown loafers to maintain a monochrome look. This outfit is perfect for the office or a weekend brunch with friends. j.crew Pullover Sweater With Scarf Madewell The Harlow Superwide-Leg Trouser in Brushed Twill Madewell The Grayson Penny Loafer j.crew Berkeley Bucket Bag in Leather and Suede Outfit #2(Image credit: J.Crew; Madewell)Looking to create an expensive-looking outfit without breaking the bank? Here's a pro tip: The classic combination of black and white can instantly elevate your look. That's why I decided to curate a chic black-and-white ensemble featuring pieces from J.Crew and Madewell. I started with a versatile white button-down shirt—an absolute wardrobe essential—and white jeans. But let's be honest. Accessories are the key to making this outfit shine. I selected Madewell's Western-inspired belt, paired it with the brand's timeless ankle boots, and topped it off with a chic chain-link necklace from J.Crew to tie in the gold. This outfit exudes sophistication and elegance while staying budget-friendly. j.crew Garçon Classic Shirt in Cotton Poplin j.crew High-Rise Straight Jean in 1996 Semi-Stretch Madewell Triple Metal Keeper Belt Madewell The Dimes Stiletto-Heel Ankle Boot j.crew Metallic Chainlink Necklace Outfit #3(Image credit: J.Crew; Madewell)After hearing Eliza Huber, senior editor at Who What Wear, enthusiastically praise J.Crew's Cashmere Shrunken Crewneck Sweater, I was convinced it deserved a place in this shopping guide. She frequently emphasizes its remarkable comfort and how it perfectly hits below the belly button, creating a flattering silhouette. Eliza also suggests opting for a size up and washing it to achieve an ideal fit that feels tailor-made. This versatile piece is elegant when paired with a flowing maxi skirt, yet it seamlessly transitions to a more casual vibe with baggy or straight-leg jeans and stylish boots, showcasing its true adaptability for any occasion. j.crew Cashmere Shrunken Crewneck Sweater madewell The '90s Straight Jeans j.crew New Stevie Ankle Boots in Leather j.crew Metallic Ball Earrings Outfit #4(Image credit: J.Crew, Madewell)If you're searching for a winter dress for a bridal shower, date night, or cocktail party, end your search with exquisite offerings from J.Crew and Madewell. One standout piece is Madewell's Merino Wool Sweater Maxi Dress, which envelops you in luxurious comfort reminiscent of a cozy blanket. Its A-line silhouette not only flatters various body shapes but also adds a touch of sophistication to your look. While the dress pairs nicely with socks and loafers, it looks the most stylish with pointed-toe knee-high leather boots that peek out from the hem. Complete the outfit with J.Crew's Bordeaux Bag, which looks three times its price. Madewell Merino Wool Sweater Maxi Dress j.crew New Stevie Knee-High Pull-On Boots in Leather Outfit #5(Image credit: J.Crew, Madewell)Lastly, let's explore a French-inspired slip-skirt outfit. French women have perfected the art of styling this sleek skirt silhouette, transforming it into a statement piece that looks rich and approachable. Their secret lies in skillfully pairing the skirt with elevated basics. For example, they often choose a fitted turtleneck sweater that hugs the body just right, an oversize coat for a sense of ease, and flat shoes for all-day comfort. For an added touch of style, they typically incorporate a palette of classic shades like soft camel, pristine ivory, crisp white, warm chocolate brown, and deep burgundy—which all harmoniously elevate the overall aesthetic. j.crew Daphne Topcoat in Italian Boiled Wool J.Crew Tissue Crepe Turtleneck Madewell Satin Maxi Slip Skirt Madewell The Greta Ballet Flat Madewell Cable-Knit Trouser Socks Nikki Chwatt is an associate fashion editor based in New York City. She joined Who What Wear in 2024 after writing fashion, beauty, and lifestyle content for WWD, Well+Good, Editorialist, and more. With a passion for personal style and the creativity that comes with it, one of Chwatt's goals is to help others understand that there is no such thing as a “good” or “bad” style; it’s just about putting an outfit together that makes you feel confident in yourself. When she's not writing, you can find her taking a Pilates class, reading a powerful romance novel, or exploring a new wellness spot in Manhattan.
html:
I'm not sure if many people know this, but one of my favorite pastimes is curating my ideal outfits from various brands and retailers. It's a thrilling yet dangerously tempting hobby; I often purchase far more than I intend to. If you're on a budget or participating in a no-spend challenge this January, you might want to steer clear of this activity.

Recently, as I was piecing together looks from both J.Crew and Madewell, I decided to take on a fun challenge: creating five stylish winter outfits that wouldn't break the bank.

What follows are carefully selected outfits that cater to various occasions this winter. Whether you're seeking a chic ensemble for a cozy weekend getaway, a romantic date night with someone special, or perhaps a fresh take on your workwear, I've got you covered. With an array of cozy sweaters, sophisticated wool coats, and timeless boots, each outfit exudes elevated style for the chilly season. The cherry on top? None of the curated looks exceeds $452.

Outfit #1

When I saw this sweater with the attached scarf, I knew I had to create an outfit around it. Initially, I considered pairing it with blue straight-leg jeans. However, I found the perfect pair of wide-leg trousers in a complementary shade. I added J.Crew's best-selling brown suede bucket bagand supple chocolate-brown loafers to maintain a monochrome look. This outfit is perfect for the office or a weekend brunch with friends.

j.crew

Pullover Sweater With Scarf

Madewell

The Harlow Superwide-Leg Trouser in Brushed Twill

Madewell

The Grayson Penny Loafer

j.crew

Berkeley Bucket Bag in Leather and Suede

Outfit #2

Looking to create an expensive-looking outfit without breaking the bank? Here's a pro tip: The classic combination of black and white can instantly elevate your look. That's why I decided to curate a chic black-and-white ensemble featuring pieces from J.Crew and Madewell. I started with a versatile white button-down shirt—an absolute wardrobe essential—and white jeans. But let's be honest. Accessories are the key to making this outfit shine. I selected Madewell's Western-inspired belt, paired it with the brand's timeless ankle boots, and topped it off with a chic chain-link necklace from J.Crew to tie in the gold. This outfit exudes sophistication and elegance while staying budget-friendly.

j.crew

Garçon Classic Shirt in Cotton Poplin

j.crew

High-Rise Straight Jean in 1996 Semi-Stretch

Madewell

Triple Metal Keeper Belt

Madewell

The Dimes Stiletto-Heel Ankle Boot

j.crew

Metallic Chainlink Necklace

Outfit #3

After hearing Eliza Huber, senior editor at Who What Wear, enthusiastically praise J.Crew's Cashmere Shrunken Crewneck Sweater, I was convinced it deserved a place in this shopping guide. She frequently emphasizes its remarkable comfort and how it perfectly hits below the belly button, creating a flattering silhouette. Eliza also suggests opting for a size up and washing it to achieve an ideal fit that feels tailor-made. This versatile piece is elegant when paired with a flowing maxi skirt, yet it seamlessly transitions to a more casual vibe with baggy or straight-leg jeans and stylish boots, showcasing its true adaptability for any occasion.

j.crew

Cashmere Shrunken Crewneck Sweater

madewell

The '90s Straight Jeans

j.crew

New Stevie Ankle Boots in Leather

j.crew

Metallic Ball Earrings

Outfit #4

If you're searching for a winter dress for a bridal shower, date night, or cocktail party, end your search with exquisite offerings from J.Crew and Madewell. One standout piece is Madewell's Merino Wool Sweater Maxi Dress, which envelops you in luxurious comfort reminiscent of a cozy blanket. Its A-line silhouette not only flatters various body shapes but also adds a touch of sophistication to your look. While the dress pairs nicely with socks and loafers, it looks the most stylish with pointed-toe knee-high leather boots that peek out from the hem. Complete the outfit with J.Crew's Bordeaux Bag, which looks three times its price.

Madewell

Merino Wool Sweater Maxi Dress

j.crew

New Stevie Knee-High Pull-On Boots in Leather

Outfit #5

Lastly, let's explore a French-inspired slip-skirt outfit. French women have perfected the art of styling this sleek skirt silhouette, transforming it into a statement piece that looks rich and approachable. Their secret lies in skillfully pairing the skirt with elevated basics. For example, they often choose a fitted turtleneck sweater that hugs the body just right, an oversize coat for a sense of ease, and flat shoes for all-day comfort. For an added touch of style, they typically incorporate a palette of classic shades like soft camel, pristine ivory, crisp white, warm chocolate brown, and deep burgundy—which all harmoniously elevate the overall aesthetic.

j.crew

Daphne Topcoat in Italian Boiled Wool

J.Crew

Tissue Crepe Turtleneck

Madewell

Satin Maxi Slip Skirt

Madewell

The Greta Ballet Flat

Madewell

Cable-Knit Trouser Socks

Nikki Chwatt is an associate fashion editor based in New York City. She joined Who What Wear in 2024 after writing fashion, beauty, and lifestyle content for WWD, Well+Good, Editorialist, and more. With a passion for personal style and the creativity that comes with it, one of Chwatt's goals is to help others understand that there is no such thing as a “good” or “bad” style; it’s just about putting an outfit together that makes you feel confident in yourself. When she's not writing, you can find her taking a Pilates class, reading a powerful romance novel, or exploring a new wellness spot in Manhattan.
